radiographic_examinations.findings: The echogenicity of the liver is normal. There are no focal hepatic lesions. The CBD is dilated throughout its course, measuring 6 mm distally at the pancreatic head where an about 1.2 x 0.6 cm shadowing stone is seen. The pancreatic duct itself is normal in size. No stones are seen in the gallbladder; however, there is gallbladder distention, wall edema and pericholecystic fluid. There is no intrahepatic biliary dilatation. The spleen is normal, measuring 11 cm. There is no ascites.
